009
010package imagingbook.common.threshold.global;
011
012/**
013 * <p>
014 * This is an implementation of the global thresholder proposed by Ridler and Calvard [1].
015 * See Sec. 9.1.3 (Alg. 9.3) of [2] for a detailed description.
016 * </p>
017 * <p>
018 * [1] T.W. Ridler, S. Calvard, Picture thresholding using an iterative selection method,
019 * IEEE Transactions on Systems, Man and Cybernetics, SMC-8 (August 1978) 630-632.
020 * <br>
021 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
022 * </p>
023 * 
024 * @author WB
025 * @version 2022/04/02
026 */
027public class IsodataThresholder implements GlobalThresholder {
028        
029        private int MAX_ITERATIONS = 100;
030
031        private double[] M0 = null;             // table of background means
032        private double[] M1 = null;             // table of foreground means
033        
034        public IsodataThresholder() {
035                super();
036        }
037
038        @Override
039        public int getThreshold(int[] h) {
040                makeMeanTables(h);
041                int K = h.length;
042                int q = (int) M0[K-1];  // start with total mean
043                int q_;
044                
045                int i = 0;
046                do {
047                        i++; 
048                        if (M0[q] < 0 || M1[q] < 0)  // background or foreground is empty
049                                return -1;
050                        q_ = q;                         
051                        q = (int) ((M0[q] + M1[q]) / 2);
052                } while (q != q_ && i < MAX_ITERATIONS);
053                
054                return q;
055        }
056        
057        private void makeMeanTables(int[] h) {
058                int K = h.length;
059                M0 = new double[K];
060                M1 = new double[K];
061                
062                int n0 = 0;
063                long s0 = 0;
064                for (int q = 0; q < K; q++) {
065                        n0 = n0 + h[q];
066                        s0 = s0 + q * h[q];
067                        M0[q] = (n0 > 0) ? ((double) s0)/n0 : -1;
068                }
069//              int N = n0;
070                
071                int n1 = 0;
072                long s1 = 0;
073                M1[K-1] = 0;
074                for (int q = h.length-2; q >= 0; q--) {
075                        n1 = n1 + h[q+1];
076                        s1 = s1 + (q+1) * h[q+1];
077                        M1[q] = (n1 > 0) ? ((double) s1)/n1 : -1;
078                }
079                
080//              return N;
081        }
082        
083}
